IDS.name: actuator
IDS.documentation: Generic simple description of a heating/current drive actuator, for a first simplified version of the Plasma Simulator component

field.name: ids_properties
field.documentation: Interface Data Structure properties. This element identifies the node above as an IDS

field.name: comment
field.documentation: Any comment describing the content of this IDS

field.name: homogeneous_time
field.documentation: 1 if the time of this IDS is homogeneous. In this case, the time values for this IDS are stored in ../time just below the root of this IDS. Otherwise, the time values are stored in the various time fields at lower levels in the tree.

field.name: cocos
field.documentation: Coordinate conventions of this IDS, expected to be 11 for ITER data

field.name: name
field.documentation: Name of the actuator (IC, EC, NBI, LH)

field.name: channels
field.documentation: ID of the multiple channels of the actuator: Beam boxes for NBI, EC or IC launcher, ...

field.name: power
field.documentation: Power delivered at the output of the actuator, in the vessel (NB this is before the coupling / beam blocking / shine through / orbit losses calculations)

field.name: generic_dynamic
field.documentation: Generic 2D dynamic slot for storing an actuator control parameter (e.g. the angle of an ECRH mirror)

field.documentation: Poloidal mode numbers, used to describe the spectrum of the antenna current. The poloidal angle is defined from the reference point; the angle at a point (R,Z) is given by atan((Z-Zref)/(R-Rref)), where Rref=reference_point/r and Zref=reference_point/z

field.documentation: Spectrum of the total surface current on the antenna strap and passive components expressed in poloidal and toroidal modes

IDS.name: atomic_data
IDS.documentation: Atomic, molecular, nuclear and surface physics data. Each occurrence contains the atomic data for a given element (nuclear charge), describing various physical processes. For each process, atomic data tables are organized by charge states. The coordinate system used by the atomic data tables is described under the coordinate_system node.

field.name: ids_properties
field.documentation: Interface Data Structure properties. This element identifies the node above as an IDS

field.name: comment
field.documentation: Any comment describing the content of this IDS

field.name: homogeneous_time
field.documentation: 1 if the time of this IDS is homogeneous. In this case, the time values for this IDS are stored in ../time just below the root of this IDS. Otherwise, the time values are stored in the various time fields at lower levels in the tree.

field.name: cocos
field.documentation: Coordinate conventions of this IDS, expected to be 11 for ITER data

field.name: z_n
field.documentation: Nuclear charge

field.name: a
field.documentation: Mass of atom

field.name: process
field.documentation: Description and data for a set of physical processes.

field.name: label
field.documentation: String identifying the process (e.g. EI, RC, ...)

field.name: table_dimension
field.documentation: Table dimensionality of the process (1 to 6), valid for all charge states. Indicates which of the tables is filled (below the charge_state node)

field.name: coordinate_index
field.documentation: Index in tables_coord, specifying what coordinate systems to use for this process (valid for all tables)

field.name: result_label
field.documentation: Description of the process result (rate, cross section, sputtering yield, ...)

field.name: result_units
field.documentation: Units of the process result

field.name: result_transformation
field.documentation: Transformation of the process result. Integer flag: 0=no transformation; 1=10^; 2=exp()

field.name: charge_state
field.documentation: Process tables for a set of charge states. Only one table is used for that process, defined by process(:)/table_dimension

field.name: label
field.documentation: String identifying charge state (e.g. C+, C+2 , C+3, C+4, C+5, C+6, ...)

field.name: z_min
field.documentation: Minimum Z of the charge state bundle

field.name: z_max
field.documentation: Maximum Z of the charge state bundle (equal to z_min if no bundle)

field.name: table_0d
field.documentation: 0D table describing the process data

field.name: table_1d
field.documentation: 1D table describing the process data

field.name: table_2d
field.documentation: 2D table describing the process data

field.name: table_3d
field.documentation: 3D table describing the process data

field.name: table_4d
field.documentation: 4D table describing the process data

field.name: table_5d
field.documentation: 5D table describing the process data

field.name: table_6d
field.documentation: 6D table describing the process data

field.name: coordinate_system
field.documentation: Array of possible coordinate systems for process tables

field.name: coordinate
field.documentation: Set of coordinates for that coordinate system. A coordinate an be either a range of real values or a set of discrete values (if interpolation_type=0)

field.name: label
field.documentation: Description of coordinate (e.g. "Electron temperature")

field.name: values
field.documentation: Coordinate values

field.name: interpolation_type
field.documentation: Interpolation strategy in this coordinate direction. Integer flag: 0=discrete (no interpolation); 1=linear; ...

field.name: extrapolation_type
field.documentation: Extrapolation strategy when leaving the domain. The first value of the vector describes the behaviour at lower bound, the second describes the at upper bound. Possible values: 0=none, report error; 1=boundary value; 2=linear extrapolation

field.name: value_labels
field.documentation: String description of discrete coordinate values (if interpolation_type=0). E.g., for spectroscopic lines, the spectroscopic description of the transition.

field.name: units
field.documentation: Units of coordinate (e.g. eV)

field.name: transformation
field.documentation: Coordinate transformation applied to coordinate values stored in coord. Integer flag: 0=none; 1=log10; 2=ln

field.name: spacing
field.documentation: Flag for specific coordinate spacing (for optimization purposes). Integer flag: 0=undefined; 1=uniform; ...

field.name: vacuum_toroidal_field
field.documentation: Characteristics of the vacuum toroidal field (used in Rho_Tor definition and in the normalization of current densities)

field.name: r0
field.documentation: Reference major radius where the vacuum toroidal magnetic field is given (usually a fixed position such as the middle of the vessel at the equatorial midplane)

field.name: b0
field.documentation: Vacuum toroidal field at R0 [T]; When using cocos = 11 (expected for ITER data), positive sign means anti-clockwise when viewed from above. The product R0B0 must be consistent with the b_tor_vacuum_r field of the tf IDS.

field.documentation: Radial grid

field.name: rho_tor_norm
field.documentation: Normalised toroidal flux coordinate. The normalizing value for rho_tor_norm, is the toroidal flux coordinate at the equilibrium boundary (LCFS or 99.x % of the LCFS in case of a fixed boundary equilibium calculation)

field.name: rho_tor
field.documentation: Toroidal flux coordinate. The toroidal field used in its definition is indicated under vacuum_toroidal_field/b0

field.documentation: Multiple charge state calculation flag : 0-Only one charge state is considered; 1-Multiple charge states are considered and are described in the charge_state structure

field.name: charge_state
field.documentation: Quantities related to the different charge states of the ion species

field.name: z_min
field.documentation: Minimum Z of the charge state bundle

field.name: z_max
field.documentation: Maximum Z of the charge state bundle (equal to z_min if no bundle)

field.name: label
field.documentation: String identifying charge state (e.g. C+, C+2 , C+3, C+4, C+5, C+6, ...)

field.name: n_z
field.documentation: Density of the charge state considered (thermal+non-thermal)

field.name: n_z_fast
field.documentation: Density of fast (non-thermal) ions, for the charge state considered

field.name: t_z
field.documentation: Temperature of the charge state considered

field.name: p_z
field.documentation: Pressure of the charge state considered

field.name: p_z_fast_perpendicular
field.documentation: Fast perpendicular pressure of the charge state considered

field.name: p_z_fast_parallel
field.documentation: Fast parallel pressure of the charge state considered

field.name: v_tor_z
field.documentation: Toroidal velocity of the charge state considered

field.name: v_pol_z
field.documentation: Poloidal velocity of the charge state considered

field.name: n_i_total_over_n_e
field.documentation: Ratio of total ion density (sum over species and charge states) over electron density. (thermal+non-thermal)

field.name: momentum_tor
field.documentation: Total plasma toroidal momentum, summed over ion species and electrons

field.name: zeff
field.documentation: Effective charge

field.name: p_e
field.documentation: Electron pressure

field.name: p_e_fast_perpendicular
field.documentation: Fast (non-thermal) electron perpendicular pressure

field.name: p_e_fast_parallel
field.documentation: Fast (non-thermal) electron parallel pressure

field.name: p_i_total
field.documentation: Total ion pressure (sum over the ion species)

field.name: p_i_total_fast_perpendicular
field.documentation: Fast (non-thermal) total ion (sum over the ion species) perpendicular pressure

field.name: p_i_total_fast_parallel
field.documentation: Fast (non-thermal) total ion (sum over the ion species) parallel pressure

field.name: pressure_thermal
field.documentation: Thermal pressure (electrons+ions)

field.name: pressure_perpendicular
field.documentation: Total perpendicular pressure (electrons+ions, thermal+non-thermal)

field.name: pressure_parallel
field.documentation: Total parallel pressure (electrons+ions, thermal+non-thermal)

field.name: j_total
field.documentation: Total parallel current density = average(jtot.B) / B0, where B0 = Core_Profiles/Vacuum_Toroidal_Field/ B0

field.name: j_tor
field.documentation: Total toroidal current density = average(J_Tor/R) / average(1/R)

field.name: j_ohmic
field.documentation: Ohmic parallel current density = average(J_Ohmic.B) / B0, where B0 = Core_Profiles/Vacuum_Toroidal_Field/ B0

field.name: j_non_inductive
field.documentation: Non-inductive (includes bootstrap) parallel current density = average(jni.B) / B0, where B0 = Core_Profiles/Vacuum_Toroidal_Field/ B0

field.name: j_bootstrap
field.documentation: Bootstrap current density = average(J_Bootstrap.B) / B0, where B0 = Core_Profiles/Vacuum_Toroidal_Field/ B0

field.name: conductivity_parallel
field.documentation: Parallel conductivity

field.name: e_field_parallel
field.documentation: Parallel electric field = average(E.B) / B0, where Core_Profiles/Vacuum_Toroidal_Field/ B0

field.name: q
field.documentation: Safety factor

field.name: magnetic_shear
field.documentation: Magnetic shear, defined as rho_tor/q . dq/drho_tor

field.name: global_quantities
field.documentation: Various global quantities derived from the profiles

field.name: ip
field.documentation: Total plasma current

field.name: current_non_inductive
field.documentation: Total non-inductive parallel current

field.name: current_bootstrap
field.documentation: Bootstrap current

field.name: v_loop
field.documentation: LCFS loop voltage

field.name: li
field.documentation: Internal inductance. The li_3 definition is used, i.e. li_3 = 2/R0/mu0^2/Ip^2 * int(Bp^2 dV).

field.name: beta_tor
field.documentation: Toroidal beta, defined as the volume-averaged total perpendicular pressure divided by (B0^2/(2*mu0)), i.e. beta_toroidal = 2 mu0 int(p dV) / V / B0^2

field.name: beta_tor_norm
field.documentation: Normalised toroidal beta, defined as 100 * beta_tor * a[m] * B0 [T] / ip [MA]

field.name: beta_pol
field.documentation: Poloidal beta. Defined as betap = 4 int(p dV) / [R_0 * mu_0 * Ip^2]

field.name: energy_diamagnetic
field.documentation: Plasma energy content = 3/2 * integral over the plasma volume of the total perpendicular pressure

field.name: vacuum_toroidal_field
field.documentation: Characteristics of the vacuum toroidal field (used in rho_tor definition and in the normalization of current densities)

field.name: r0
field.documentation: Reference major radius where the vacuum toroidal magnetic field is given (usually a fixed position such as the middle of the vessel at the equatorial midplane)

field.name: b0
field.documentation: Vacuum toroidal field at R0 [T]; When using cocos = 11 (expected for ITER data), positive sign means anti-clockwise when viewed from above. The product R0B0 must be consistent with the b_tor_vacuum_r field of the tf IDS.

field.documentation: Major radius

field.documentation: Toroidal angle

field.documentation: Angle of inclination between a beamlet at the centre of the injection unit surface and the horiontal plane

field.name: direction
field.documentation: Direction of the beam seen from above the torus: -1 = clockwise; 1 = counter clockwise

field.name: width_horizontal
field.documentation: Horizontal width of the beam group at the injection unit surface (or grounded grid)

field.name: width_vertical
field.documentation: Vertical width of the beam group at the injection unit surface (or grounded grid)

field.name: focus
field.documentation: Describes how the beamlet group is focused

field.name: focal_length_horizontal
field.documentation: Horizontal focal length along the beam line, i.e. the point along the centre of the beamlet-group where the beamlet-group has its minimum horizontal width

field.name: focal_length_vertical
field.documentation: Vertical focal length along the beam line, i.e. the point along the centre of the beamlet-group where the beamlet-group has its minimum vertical width

field.name: width_min_horizontal
field.documentation: The horizontal width of the beamlets group at the at the horizontal focal point

field.name: width_min_vertical
field.documentation: The vertical width of the beamlets group at the at the vertical focal point

field.name: divergence_component
field.documentation: Detailed information on beamlet divergence. Divergence is described as a superposition of Gaussian components with amplitide "particles_fraction" and vertical/horizontal divergence. Note that for positive ion NBI the divergence is well described by a single Gaussian

field.name: particles_fraction
field.documentation: Fraction of injected particles in the component

field.name: vertical
field.documentation: The vertical beamlet divergence of the component. Here the divergence is defined for Gaussian beams as the angel where the beam density is reduced by a factor 1/e compared to the maximum density. For non-Gaussian beams the divergence is sqrt(2)*mean((x-mean(x))**2), where x is the angle and the mean should be performed over the beam density, P(x): mean(y)=int(y*P(x)*dx).

field.name: horizontal
field.documentation: The horiztonal beamlet divergence of the component. Here the divergence is defined for Gaussian beams as the angel where the beam density is reduced by a factor 1/e compared to the maximum density. For non-Gaussian beams the divergence is sqrt(2)*mean((x-mean(x))**2), where x is the angle and the mean should be performed over the beam density, P(x): mean(y)=int(y*P(x)*dx).

field.documentation: Angle of inclination between a line at the centre of a beamlet and the horiontal plane

field.name: power_fraction
field.documentation: Fraction of power of a unit injected by a beamlet

IDS.name: pellets
IDS.documentation: Description of pellets launched into the plasma

field.name: ids_properties
field.documentation: Interface Data Structure properties. This element identifies the node above as an IDS

field.name: comment
field.documentation: Any comment describing the content of this IDS

field.name: homogeneous_time
field.documentation: 1 if the time of this IDS is homogeneous. In this case, the time values for this IDS are stored in ../time just below the root of this IDS. Otherwise, the time values are stored in the various time fields at lower levels in the tree.

field.name: cocos
field.documentation: Coordinate conventions of this IDS, expected to be 11 for ITER data

field.name: time_slice
field.documentation: Description of the pellets launched at various time slices. The time of this structure corresponds to the full ablation of the pellet inside the plasma.

field.name: pellet
field.documentation: Set of pellets ablated in the plasma at a given time

field.name: shape
field.documentation: Initial shape of a pellet at launch

field.name: type
field.documentation: Identifier structure for the shape type: 1-spherical; 2-cylindrical; 3-rectangular

field.name: name
field.documentation: Short string identifier

field.name: index
field.documentation: Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list)

field.name: description
field.documentation: Verbose description

field.name: size
field.documentation: Size of the pellet in the various dimensions, depending on the shape type. Spherical pellets: size(1) is the radius of the pellet. Cylindrical pellets: size(1) is the radius and size(2) is the height of the cylinder. Rectangular pellets: size(1) is the height, size(2) is the width and size(3) is the length

field.name: species
field.documentation: Set of species included in the pellet composition

field.name: a
field.documentation: Mass of atom

field.name: z_n
field.documentation: Nuclear charge

field.name: label
field.documentation: String identifying the species (e.g. H, D, T, ...)

field.name: density
field.documentation: Material density of the species in the pellet

field.name: fraction
field.documentation: Fraction of the species atoms in the pellet

field.name: sublimation_energy
field.documentation: Sublimation energy per atom

field.name: velocity_initial
field.documentation: Initial velocity of the pellet as it enters the vaccum chamber

field.name: path_geometry
field.documentation: Geometry of the pellet path in the vaccuum chamber

field.name: first_point
field.documentation: Position of the first point

field.name: r
field.documentation: Major radius

field.name: phi
field.documentation: Toroidal angle

field.name: second_point
field.documentation: Position of the second point

field.name: r
field.documentation: Major radius

field.name: phi
field.documentation: Toroidal angle

field.name: path_profiles
field.documentation: 1-D profiles of plasma and pellet along the pellet path

field.name: distance
field.documentation: Distance along the pellet path, with the origin taken at path_geometry/first_point. Used as the main coordinate for the path_profiles structure

field.name: rho_tor_norm
field.documentation: Normalised toroidal coordinate along the pellet path

field.name: psi
field.documentation: Poloidal flux along the pellet path

field.name: velocity
field.documentation: Pellet velocity along the pellet path

field.name: n_e
field.documentation: Electron density along the pellet path

field.name: t_e
field.documentation: Electron temperature along the pellet path

field.name: ablation_rate
field.documentation: Ablation rate (electrons) along the pellet path

field.name: ablated_particles
field.documentation: Number of ablated particles (electrons) along the pellet path

field.name: rho_tor_norm_drift
field.documentation: Difference to due ExB drifts between the ablation and the final deposition locations, in terms of the normalised toroidal flux coordinate

field.name: position
field.documentation: Position along the pellet path

field.name: r
field.documentation: Major radius

field.name: phi
field.documentation: Toroidal angle

field.name: comment
field.documentation: Any comment describing the content of this IDS

field.documentation: Active PF coils

field.documentation: Alphanumeric identifier of coils used for convenience

field.documentation: Current in the coil

field.documentation: Voltage on the coil terminals

field.name: vertical_force
field.documentation: Vertical forces on the axisymmetric PF coil system

field.name: name
field.documentation: Name of the force combination

field.name: combination
field.documentation: Coils involved in the force combinations. Normally the vertical force would be the full set of coils, but in some cases, we want to have a difference in forces, such as a CS coil separation force. We therefore give each coil a force weight which we call the combination

field.name: limit_max
field.documentation: Vertical force combination limit

field.name: limit_min
field.documentation: Vertical force combination limit

field.name: force
field.documentation: Force

field.name: data
field.documentation: Force

field.name: time
field.documentation: Generic time [s]

field.name: circuit
field.documentation: Circuits, connecting multiple PF coils to multiple supplies, defining the current and voltage relationships in the system

field.name: name
field.documentation: Name of the circuit

field.name: identifier
field.documentation: ID of the circuit

field.name: type
field.documentation: Type of the circuit

field.name: connections
field.documentation: Description of the supplies and coils connections (nodes) across the circuit. The matrix describing for each node (first dimension) which components are connected to it (1 if connected, 0 otherwise). There are 2 sides to each component, thus 2*ncomponents as the size of the second dimension, listing first all supplies, then all coils (in the same order as listed in SUPPLIES and COILS). An example can be found in the data structure documentation PFconnections.pdf (TBD)

field.name: voltage
field.documentation: Voltage on the circuit

field.name: data
field.documentation: Voltage on the circuit

field.name: identifier
field.documentation: Identifier of the supply

field.name: type
field.documentation: Type of the supply; TBD add free description of non-linear power supplies

field.name: resistance
field.documentation: Power supply internal resistance

field.name: delay
field.documentation: Pure delay in the supply

field.name: filter_numerator
field.documentation: Coefficients of the numerator, in increasing order : a0 + a1*s + ... + an*s^n; used for a linear supply description

field.name: filter_denominator
field.documentation: Coefficients of the denominator, in increasing order : b0 + b1*s + ... + bm*s^m; used for a linear supply description

field.name: current_limit_max
field.documentation: Maximum current in the supply

field.name: current_limit_min
field.documentation: Minimum current in the supply

field.name: voltage_limit_max
field.documentation: Maximum voltage from the supply

field.name: voltage_limit_min
field.documentation: Minimum voltage from the supply

field.name: current_limiter_gain
field.documentation: Gain to prevent overcurrent in a linear model of the supply

field.name: energy_limit_max
field.documentation: Maximum energy to be dissipated in the supply during a pulse

field.name: nonlinear_model
field.documentation: Description of the nonlinear transfer function of the supply

field.name: voltage
field.documentation: Voltage at the supply output

field.name: data
field.documentation: Voltage at the supply output

field.name: time
field.documentation: Generic time [s]

field.name: current
field.documentation: Current at the supply output, defined positive if it flows from point 1 to point 2 of the component in the pfcircuit description

field.name: data
field.documentation: Current at the supply output, defined positive if it flows from point 1 to point 2 of the component in the pfcircuit description

IDS.name: sawteeth
IDS.documentation: Description of sawtooth events. This IDS must be used in homogeneous_time = 1 mode

field.name: ids_properties
field.documentation: Interface Data Structure properties. This element identifies the node above as an IDS

field.name: comment
field.documentation: Any comment describing the content of this IDS

field.name: homogeneous_time
field.documentation: 1 if the time of this IDS is homogeneous. In this case, the time values for this IDS are stored in ../time just below the root of this IDS. Otherwise, the time values are stored in the various time fields at lower levels in the tree.

field.name: cocos
field.documentation: Coordinate conventions of this IDS, expected to be 11 for ITER data

field.name: vacuum_toroidal_field
field.documentation: Characteristics of the vacuum toroidal field (used in rho_tor definition)

field.name: r0
field.documentation: Reference major radius where the vacuum toroidal magnetic field is given (usually a fixed position such as the middle of the vessel at the equatorial midplane)

field.name: b0
field.documentation: Vacuum toroidal field at R0 [T]; When using cocos = 11 (expected for ITER data), positive sign means anti-clockwise when viewed from above. The product R0B0 must be consistent with the b_tor_vacuum_r field of the tf IDS.

field.name: profiles_1d
field.documentation: Core profiles after sawtooth crash for various time slices

field.name: grid
field.documentation: Radial grid

field.name: rho_tor_norm
field.documentation: Normalised toroidal flux coordinate. The normalizing value for rho_tor_norm, is the toroidal flux coordinate at the equilibrium boundary (LCFS or 99.x % of the LCFS in case of a fixed boundary equilibium calculation)

field.name: rho_tor
field.documentation: Toroidal flux coordinate. The toroidal field used in its definition is indicated under vacuum_toroidal_field/b0

field.name: psi
field.documentation: Poloidal magnetic flux

field.name: volume
field.documentation: Volume enclosed inside the magnetic surface

field.name: area
field.documentation: Cross-sectional area of the flux surface

field.name: t_e
field.documentation: Electron temperature

field.name: t_i_average
field.documentation: Ion temperature (averaged on charge states and ion species)

field.name: n_e
field.documentation: Electron density (thermal+non-thermal)

field.name: n_e_fast
field.documentation: Density of fast (non-thermal) electrons

field.name: n_i_total_over_n_e
field.documentation: Ratio of total ion density (sum over species and charge states) over electron density. (thermal+non-thermal)

field.name: momentum_tor
field.documentation: Total plasma toroidal momentum, summed over ion species and electrons

field.name: zeff
field.documentation: Effective charge

field.name: p_e
field.documentation: Electron pressure

field.name: p_e_fast_perpendicular
field.documentation: Fast (non-thermal) electron perpendicular pressure

field.name: p_e_fast_parallel
field.documentation: Fast (non-thermal) electron parallel pressure

field.name: p_i_total
field.documentation: Total ion pressure (sum over the ion species)

field.name: p_i_total_fast_perpendicular
field.documentation: Fast (non-thermal) total ion (sum over the ion species) perpendicular pressure

field.name: p_i_total_fast_parallel
field.documentation: Fast (non-thermal) total ion (sum over the ion species) parallel pressure

field.name: pressure_thermal
field.documentation: Thermal pressure (electrons+ions)

field.name: pressure_perpendicular
field.documentation: Total perpendicular pressure (electrons+ions, thermal+non-thermal)

field.name: pressure_parallel
field.documentation: Total parallel pressure (electrons+ions, thermal+non-thermal)

field.name: j_total
field.documentation: Total parallel current density = average(jtot.B) / B0, where B0 = Core_Profiles/Vacuum_Toroidal_Field/ B0

field.name: j_tor
field.documentation: Total toroidal current density = average(J_Tor/R) / average(1/R)

field.name: j_ohmic
field.documentation: Ohmic parallel current density = average(J_Ohmic.B) / B0, where B0 = Core_Profiles/Vacuum_Toroidal_Field/ B0

field.name: j_non_inductive
field.documentation: Non-inductive (includes bootstrap) parallel current density = average(jni.B) / B0, where B0 = Core_Profiles/Vacuum_Toroidal_Field/ B0

field.name: j_bootstrap
field.documentation: Bootstrap current density = average(J_Bootstrap.B) / B0, where B0 = Core_Profiles/Vacuum_Toroidal_Field/ B0

field.name: conductivity_parallel
field.documentation: Parallel conductivity

field.name: e_field_parallel
field.documentation: Parallel electric field = average(E.B) / B0, where Core_Profiles/Vacuum_Toroidal_Field/ B0

field.name: q
field.documentation: Safety factor

field.name: magnetic_shear
field.documentation: Magnetic shear, defined as rho_tor/q . dq/drho_tor

field.name: phi
field.documentation: Toroidal flux

field.name: psi_star_pre_crash
field.documentation: Psi* = psi - phi, just before the sawtooth crash

field.name: psi_star_post_crash
field.documentation: Psi* = psi - phi, after the sawtooth crash

field.name: diagnostics
field.documentation: Detailed information about the sawtooth characteristics

field.name: magnetic_shear_q1
field.documentation: Magnetic shear at surface q = 1, defined as rho_tor/q . dq/drho_tor

field.name: rho_tor_norm_q1
field.documentation: Normalised toroidal flux coordinate at surface q = 1

field.name: rho_tor_norm_inversion
field.documentation: Normalised toroidal flux coordinate at inversion radius

field.name: rho_tor_norm_mixing
field.documentation: Normalised toroidal flux coordinate at mixing radius

field.documentation: 1 if the time of this IDS is homogeneous. In this case, the time values for this IDS are stored in ../time just below the root of this IDS. Otherwise, the time values are stored in the various time fields at lower levels in the tree.
